activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa Anna-Marie Smith

11:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CF59, 22CT6, 21TR1675, 21TR1677 AND 21TR1676.

22CF59:  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives further reading of same.
NG pleas entered.
All above set for plea hearing on same date; must appear in person.
Bonds to continue.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:00 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Theresa Anna-Marie Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Theresa Anna-Marie Smith. 
3:01 Anthony Brunner, Officer with the Turtle Lake Police Department, called, sworn, and direct by State. Witness identifies the defendant. 3:08 Cross by defense. Testimony closed. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
